item.title: Ursula K. Le Guin (October 21, 1929, to January 22, 2018)
item.description: “Hard times are coming, when we’ll be wanting the voices of writers who can see alternatives to how we live now, can see through our fear-stricken society and its obsessive technologies to other ways of being, and even imagine real grounds for hope. We’ll need writers who can remember freedom – poets, visionaries – realists of a larger reality.” – From Ursula K. Le Guin’s acceptance speech, National Book Awards, 2014.
